intro: Uragoga stricta, commonly known as the slender uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. Uragoga stricta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
